SEARCH
Module cz.cvut.fel.pjv.hofmaad
Package controller

Class MasterController

java.lang.Object
controller.MasterController
public class MasterController extends Object
Main controller class that orchestrates interactions between the simulation's UI and the underlying network models.

    • MasterController

      public MasterController(SimulationWorkspaceView simulationWorkspaceView, NetworkDeviceStorage deviceStorage, NetworksController networksController, SimulationController simulationController)
      Constructs a MasterController that integrates various components of the network simulation.
      Parameters:
      simulationWorkspaceView - The main UI view for the simulation.
      deviceStorage - Storage for network devices.
      networksController - Controller for network-related operations.
      simulationController - Controller for simulation operations.

  • Method Details

    • handleUpdateLabels

      public void handleUpdateLabels(UpdateLabelsEvent event)
      Handles an update event for a PC model. This method is invoked when an UpdateLabelsEvent is posted on the event bus. It retrieves the PCModel object from the event and performs the following actions: 1. Extracts the associated NetworkDevice from the PC model. 2. If the network device is a RouterInterface, it retrieves the actual router it's connected to visually. 3. Finds the corresponding ConnectionLine object in the simulation workspace view based on the PC model and network device. 4. Updates the appropriate label (start or end) on the connection line based on the PC model's UUID and retrieved IP address (using the last octet). 5. If no connection line is found, a message is logged indicating the issue.
      Parameters:
      event - the UpdateLabelsEvent containing the PC model data

    • addDevice

      public void addDevice(NetworkDevice networkDevice)
      Adds a network device to the simulation.
      Parameters:
      networkDevice - The network device to add.

      second - The second network device.
      Returns:
      true if the connection is successful, false otherwise.

      Returns:
